EnglishTranslation:
The claim that there is no freedom of religion in Germany and that the state forces its citizens into a particular system is not true.

In Germany, freedom of religion is guaranteed by the Basic Law (Grundgesetz), which is the constitution of the country. Article 4 of the Basic Law states that freedom of religion, conscience and the freedom to practice or not to practice religion are guaranteed. No one may be compelled to participate in religious acts or church membership.

In addition, Germany supports the principle of separation of church and state, although there is a system of church tax (German: Kirchensteuer) paid by members of some religious communities. However, participation in this tax is voluntary and depends on membership in the religious community.

Thus, the assertion that there is no freedom of religion in Germany and that a particular system is enforced is not true.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: In Deutschland gibt es keine Religionsfreiheit. Auch hier zwingt der Staat seine Bürger in ein System.
Reply:
Es scheint, als ob es ein Missverständnis über die Religionsfreiheit in Deutschland gibt. In Deutschland gibt es tatsächlich Religionsfreiheit, die durch das Grundgesetz garantiert wird. Artikel 4 des Grundgesetzes besagt:

> (1) Die Freiheit des Glaubens, des Gewissens und die Freiheit des religiösen und weltanschaulichen Bekenntnisses sind unverletzlich.
> (2) Die ungestörte Religionsausübung wird gewährleistet.
> (3) Niemand darf gegen sein Gewissen zum Kriegsdienst mit der Waffe gezwungen werden. Ein Wehrdienstgesetz, das den bisherigen Regelungen über den Kriegsdienst mit der Waffe widerspricht, verletzt nicht dieses Grundrecht, wenn die Verpflichtung zur bewaffneten Verteidigung ausnahmsweise auch in Abwehr eines Angriffs zulässig bleibt, der nicht gegen die Bundesrepublik Deutschland gerichtet ist.

Das bedeutet, dass jeder Mensch in Deutschland frei ist, seine Religion oder Weltanschauung zu wählen und auszuüben. Niemand wird gezwungen, einer bestimmten Religion anzugehören oder Steuern an eine bestimmte Kirche zu zahlen, wenn er oder sie nicht Mitglied dieser Kirche ist.

Es gibt jedoch das sogenannte Kirchensteuer-System, das oft missverstanden wird. Mitglieder bestimmter Kirchen (z.B. der katholischen oder evangelischen Kirche) zahlen eine Kirchensteuer, die von ihrem Einkommen abgezogen wird. Diese Steuer finanziert die jeweilige Kirche. Wer keiner dieser Kirchen angehört, muss auch keine Kirchensteuer zahlen. Man kann jederzeit austreten und somit die Zahlung der Kirchensteuer beenden.

Zusammengefasst: Deutschland garantiert Religionsfreiheit, und niemand wird gezwungen, einer bestimmten Religion anzugehören oder eine bestimmte Steuer zu zahlen, wenn er oder sie nicht Mitglied der entsprechenden Kirche ist.

EnglishTranslation:
There seems to be a misunderstanding about religious freedom in Germany. In Germany there is indeed freedom of religion, which is guaranteed by the Basic Law. Article 4 of the Basic Law states:

> (1) Freedom of faith, conscience and religious and philosophical belief shall be inviolable.
> (2) The undisturbed exercise of religion shall be guaranteed.
> (3) No one shall be compelled to perform military service with arms against his conscience. A military service law that contradicts the previous regulations on military service with arms shall not violate this fundamental right if the obligation to provide armed defense remains permissible as an exception, even in defense against an attack that is not directed against the Federal Republic of Germany.

This means that every person in Germany is free to choose and practice their religion or world view. No one is forced to belong to a particular religion or to pay taxes to a particular church if he or she is not a member of that church.

However, there is the so-called church tax system, which is often misunderstood. Members of certain churches (e.g. the Catholic or Protestant church) pay a church tax that is deducted from their income. This tax finances the respective church. Anyone who does not belong to one of these churches does not have to pay church tax. You can resign at any time and thus stop paying church tax.

To summarize: Germany guarantees freedom of religion, and no one is forced to belong to a particular religion or pay a particular tax if he or she is not a member of the church in question.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: Não há liberdade de religião na Alemanha. Aqui, também, o Estado força seus cidadãos a entrar em um sistema.
Reply:
A afirmação de que "Não há liberdade de religião na Alemanha" não é precisa. A Alemanha garante a liberdade de religião conforme estabelecido na sua Constituição, a Lei Fundamental da República Federal da Alemanha (Grundgesetz). O Artigo 4 da Lei Fundamental protege a liberdade de fé, de consciência e a liberdade religiosa. Os cidadãos têm o direito de professar sua fé, individual ou em comunidade, e de praticar seus ritos religiosos.

Quanto à segunda parte da declaração, "Aqui, também, o Estado força seus cidadãos a entrar em um sistema", isso pode estar se referindo ao imposto eclesiástico (Kirchensteuer) que é cobrado na Alemanha. No entanto, é importante esclarecer que ninguém é forçado a se inscrever em uma igreja ou a pagar esse imposto. Os cidadãos têm a liberdade de se afiliar ou desfiliar de uma igreja a qualquer momento. O imposto eclesiástico só é aplicado àqueles que são membros registrados de uma igreja que cobra esse imposto, e a filiação é voluntária.

Portanto, a Alemanha respeita a liberdade de religião e não força seus cidadãos a entrar em nenhum sistema religioso.
EnglishTranslation:
The statement "There is no freedom of religion in Germany" is inaccurate. Germany guarantees freedom of religion as laid down in its constitution, the Basic Law of the Federal Republic of Germany (Grundgesetz). Article 4 of the Basic Law protects freedom of faith and conscience and freedom of religion. Citizens have the right to profess their faith, individually or in community, and to practice their religious rites.

As for the second part of the statement, "Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system", this could be referring to the church tax (Kirchensteuer) that is levied in Germany. However, it is important to clarify that no one is forced to join a church or pay this tax. Citizens are free to join or leave a church at any time. The church tax is only applied to those who are registered members of a church that charges this tax, and membership is voluntary.

Germany therefore respects freedom of religion and does not force its citizens to join any religious system.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: Almanya'da din özgürlüğü yoktur. Burada da devlet vatandaşlarını bir sisteme zorluyor.
Reply:
Almanya'da din özgürlüğü konusunda yapılan bu değerlendirmeye şu şekilde yanıt verebilirim:

Almanya'da din özgürlüğü, Anayasa'nın 4. maddesi ile güvence altına alınmıştır. Bu madde, herkesin din ve inanç özgürlüğüne sahip olduğunu ve bu özgürlüğün kamusal veya özel ibadet, öğretim, uygulama ve dini törenler yoluyla bireysel veya toplu olarak yaşanabileceğini belirtir. Ancak, Almanya'da kilise vergisi gibi uygulamalar nedeniyle bazı eleştiriler yapılmaktadır. Kilise vergisi, belirli dini cemaatlere üye olan kişilerden alınan bir vergi olup, bu uygulama bazı kişiler tarafından devletin dini uygulamalara müdahalesi olarak görülebilir. 

Yine de, genel olarak Almanya'da din özgürlüğü yüksek düzeyde korunmakta ve bireyler inançlarını özgürce yaşayabilmektedir. Devletin vatandaşlarını belirli bir sisteme zorladığı iddiası, daha çok bu tür spesifik uygulamalara yönelik eleştirilerden kaynaklanıyor olabilir. Ancak, genel olarak bakıldığında, Almanya'da din özgürlüğü konusunda ciddi kısıtlamalar bulunmamaktadır.
EnglishTranslation:
I can respond to this assessment of freedom of religion in Germany in the following way:

Freedom of religion in Germany is guaranteed by Article 4 of the Basic Law. This article states that everyone has the right to freedom of religion and belief and that this freedom may be exercised individually or collectively through public or private worship, teaching, practice and religious ceremonies. However, there has been some criticism of practices such as the church tax in Germany. The church tax is a tax levied on members of certain religious communities and may be seen by some as state interference in religious practices.

Nevertheless, in general, freedom of religion is highly protected in Germany and individuals can freely practice their faith. The allegation that the state forces its citizens into a particular system may stem more from criticism of such specific practices. Overall, however, there are no serious restrictions on freedom of religion in Germany.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: Daar is geen vryheid van godsdiens in Duitsland nie.Ook hier dwing die staat sy burgers in 'n stelsel.
Reply:
Die stelling dat "Daar is geen vryheid van godsdiens in Duitsland nie. Ook hier dwing die staat sy burgers in 'n stelsel" is nie heeltemal akkuraat nie. Duitsland het wel vryheid van godsdiens wat in die grondwet gewaarborg word. Artikel 4 van die Duitse Grondwet (Grundgesetz) waarborg die vryheid van geloof, gewete en godsdiens. Dit beteken dat individue die reg het om hul godsdiens te beoefen of om geen godsdiens te beoefen nie.

Wat betref die stelling dat die staat sy burgers in 'n stelsel dwing, kan dit verwys na die kerkbelasting (Kirchensteuer) wat in Duitsland gehef word. Lidmate van sekere kerke word outomaties belas om die kerk te ondersteun, tensy hulle formeel uit die kerk bedank. Hoewel dit as 'n vorm van dwang beskou kan word, is dit belangrik om te noem dat individue die keuse het om uit die kerk te tree en sodoende die belasting te vermy.

Daarom, terwyl die stelsel van kerkbelasting debatteerbaar is, is dit nie korrek om te sê dat daar geen vryheid van godsdiens in Duitsland is nie. Die vryheid om te glo of nie te glo nie, word steeds gewaarborg.
EnglishTranslation:
The statement that "there is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state is forcing its citizens into a system" is not entirely accurate. Germany does have freedom of religion guaranteed in the Constitution. Article 4 of the German Constitution (Grundsetz) guarantees the freedom of faith, conscience and religion. This means that individuals have the right to practice their religion or to practice no religion.

Regarding the statement that the state is forcing its citizens into a system, it can refer to the church tax (Kirchensteuer) charged in Germany. Members of certain churches are automatically burdened to support the church unless they formally resign from the church. While it can be considered a form of coercion, it is important to mention that individuals have the choice to step out of the church and thus avoid the tax.

Therefore, while the church tax system is debatable, it is not correct to say that there is no freedom of religion in Germany. The freedom to believe or not to believe is still guaranteed.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: जर्मनी में धर्म की स्वतंत्रता नहीं है।यहाँ भी, राज्य अपने नागरिकों को एक प्रणाली में मजबूर करता है।
Reply:
जर्मनी में धर्म की स्वतंत्रता का मुद्दा काफी जटिल है। जर्मन संविधान, जिसे ग्रUNDGESETZ के नाम से जाना जाता है, धारा 4 में धर्म की स्वतंत्रता की गारंटी देता है। इसका मतलब है कि व्यक्तियों को अपने धर्म का पालन करने या न करने की स्वतंत्रता है। हालांकि, जर्मनी में एक अनोखी व्यवस्था है जिसे "धर्म कर" (Kirchensteuer) कहा जाता है, जिसके तहत कुछ धार्मिक समुदायों के सदस्यों को अपनी आय का एक हिस्सा अपने धार्मिक संगठन को देना पड़ता है। यह कर स्वैच्छिक नहीं है, लेकिन इससे बचने का एक तरीका है - अपने धार्मिक समुदाय से औपचारिक रूप से अलग होना।

इस प्रकार, यह कहना सही नहीं होगा कि जर्मनी में धर्म की स्वतंत्रता नहीं है। हालांकि, राज्य की ओर से लगाया गया धर्म कर एक ऐसी प्रणाली है जो कुछ लोगों को मजबूर कर सकती है, लेकिन इसका विकल्प भी मौजूद है। इसलिए, जर्मनी में धर्म की स्वतंत्रता की स्थिति को समझने के लिए इन जटिलताओं को ध्यान में रखना जरूरी है।

Ukuze sikwazi ukuphendula lesi sitatimende, kumele siqaphele ukuthi inkululeko yenkolo eJalimane iyaphindekela futhi iqinisekisiwe ngokomthetho. Umthethosisekelo weJalimane uqinisekisa inkululeko yenkolo, futhi abantu banelungelo lokukholelwa noma yikuphi ukholo abakuthandayo noma ukungakholelwa.

Ngalokho-ke, uma sithi "Ayikho inkululeko yenkolo eJalimane," lokhu akuvumelani nomthetho weJalimane. Ngaphandle kwalokho, umbuso weJalimane awuphoqi izakhamizi zawo ukuba zibe yingxenye yezinkolo ezithile noma zohlale ohlelweni oluthile. Abantu banelungelo lokukhetha ukuba yingxenye yezinkolo zabo noma ukungabi yingxenye.

Ngakho-ke, isitatimende sithi "Ayikho inkululeko yenkolo eJalimane. Lapha futhi, umbuso waphoqa izakhamizi zawo ohlelweni," asivumelani nemithetho yenkululeko yenkolo eJalimane futhi asinamthetho.

The statement: "There is no religious freedom in Germany. Here again, the State forced its citizens to the system."

In order to answer this statement, we must be careful that the religious freedom in Germany repairs and is legally guaranteed. The German Constitution guarantees religious freedom, and people have the right to believe any faith they love or disbelief.

So if we say "a religious freedom in Germany," this does not agree to Germany's law. Besides, the German empire does not force their citizens to become part of certain religions or to stay in a particular system. People have the right to choose to be part of their religions or not to be part.

Therefore, the statement is "No Religious Freedom in Germany. Here again, the State forced its citizens to the system," we disagree with the laws of the Freedom Freedom in Germany and have no law.

Statement_English: There is no freedom of religion in Germany. Here, too, the state forces its citizens into a system.
Statement_Language: در آلمان هیچ آزادی دین وجود ندارد.در اینجا ، دولت نیز شهروندان خود را به یک سیستم وادار می کند.
Reply:
پاسخ به این بیانیه می‌تواند به شرح زیر باشد:

"ادعای شما که در آلمان هیچ آزادی دین وجود ندارد، دقیق نیست. طبق قانون اساسی آلمان (Grundgesetz)، آزادی دین و عقیده در ماده 4 تضمین شده است. این ماده به شهروندان اجازه می‌دهد تا آزادانه دین خود را انتخاب کنند یا به هیچ دینی اعتقاد نداشته باشند. همچنین، دولت آلمان به جوامع دینی مختلف اجازه فعالیت می‌دهد و از آنها حمایت می‌کند.

در مورد وادار کردن شهروندان به یک سیستم، باید توضیح داد که در آلمان سیستم‌های مختلفی وجود دارد که شهروندان می‌توانند به آنها بپیوندند یا از آنها خارج شوند. به عنوان مثال، شهروندان می‌توانند عضو کلیساهای مختلف باشند یا از آنها خارج شوند و مالیات کلیسا را پرداخت نکنند. این نشان می‌دهد که آزادی دینی در آلمان به رسمیت شناخته شده و اعمال می‌شود."
EnglishTranslation:
The answer to this statement can be as follows:

"Your claim that there is no freedom of religion in Germany is not accurate. According to the German constitution, the freedom of religion and belief is guaranteed in Article 4. This article allows citizens to freely choose their religion or not believe in any religion.

When forcing citizens to a system, it should be explained that there are different systems in Germany that citizens can join or get out of. Citizens, for example, can be members of different churches or leave them and not pay the church tax. This shows that religious freedom in Germany is recognized and applied. "
